doc.field: Time Inc. Time-Life News Service Records
Time Inc. Time-Life News Service Records
Series II. New York Regional Bureau Chief and Senior Correspondent Laurence I. Barrett Files
Series II. New York Regional Bureau Chief and Senior Correspondent Laurence I. Barrett Files

The New York Regional Bureau Chief and Senior Correspondent Laurence I. Barrett Files cover the period of 1975 to 1980 and cover both his freelance work and Time political coverage. While these materials were originally housed with research for a variety of stories on Chappaquiddick, Barrett's materials appeared to be unrelated and were removed to be rehoused. Contained in this series are photographs, dispatches, clippings, notes, drafts, and correspondence.

Laurence I. Barrett, better known as Larry, first shows up in Time Inc.'s department heads lists in February 1970. At this time, Barrett was working as a senior editor at Time. Barret remained in this position until 1978 when he was promoted to New York regional bureau chief. By 1979, Barrett is no longer a bureau chief and has become a senior correspondent for the Time-Life News Service. He remains in this position through at least 1983. From 1984 forward, Barrett no longer shows up on department heads lists.
Personnel and Organization: Department Head Lists. Time Inc. Reference Files, MS 3009-RG 3, New-York Historical Society.
